simplesect.para: This chapter is about PerfCake's reporting abilities. It is configured using <reporting> element in the scenario definition.
The configuration consists of following steps:

A reporter represents a different type of the reports such as average throughput or memory usage. By configuring the destinations you tell where output should be directed by the reporter (e.g. console, CSV file, etc.).

simplesect.title: Example reporting configuration:
simplesect.programlisting:
<reporting> <reporter class="AverageThroughputReporter"> <destination class="ConsoleDestination"> <period type="time" value="1000"/> </destination> <destination class="CSVDestination"> <period type="time" value="2000"/> <property name="path" value="test-average-throughput.csv"/> </destination> </reporter>
<reporter class="MemoryUsageReporter"> <property name="agentHostname" value="localhost"/> <property name="agentPort" value="8849"/> <destination class="CSVDestination"> <period type="time" value="2000"/> <property name="path" value="test-memory-usage.csv"/> </destination> </reporter> </reporting>

simplesect.para: With this configuration the 2 reporters are specified - AverageThroughputReporter and MemoryUsageReporter . First one will report to console each 1 second and to CSV file each 2 seconds, while the second one will report memory usage of the tested system into CSV file each 2 seconds.
Following sections contain a description of reporters and destinations that can be used in PerfCake.

sect1.title: Destinations
sect1.para: The destinations are a representation of places where the measurements from the reporters are published. Each destination is configured to publish the report measurements during the scenario execution periodically with a period specified by the period element in the scenario definition. Destination can have multiple periods but each destination has to have at least one period configured.

Following table shows the destination period options:
Destination period options
Destination period type
Value description
time Time period in milliseconds
iteration Number of iterations
percentage The relative percentage of the scenario run
